input:
### INPUT STORY: My name is Ronald Smith and I hit a guy. I am 32 years old and have never done anything like this. I had been drinking with some friends and then this guy said something very rude to my friend, so I got really angry and lost control for a moment.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I stand before you today to take full responsibility for my actions. On the night in question, I had been drinking with some friends when a guy said something very rude to my friend. In my anger, I lost control and hit him. I want to make it clear that I am not offering any excuses for what happened that night. However, I do believe that my lack of criminal record and good character show that this was a momentary lapse in judgement rather than a pattern of behavior. I am pleading guilty as a mitigating factor in the hope that the court will take this into account when sentencing me. I understand the seriousness of my actions and am willing to cooperate with authorities to make things right. Furthermore, I would like to express my willingness to take actions to prevent committing the same offense again. Additionally, I understand the need for compensation for the harm done to the victim and am willing to take steps towards making this happen. In conclusion, while I cannot change what happened on that night, I hope that this court will consider all of the mitigating factors presented and show leniency in its sentencing. Thank you for your time and attention.

In conclusion, Your Honor, please consider my plea of guilty as evidence of taking responsibility for what happened on that night. Thank you for your time and consideration.

instruction: Does the statement overemphasize, or show emotions different from the input story? Please answer 'yes' or 'no'. Make sure to think carefully about what is said in the input story VS what is said in the statement.
input:
### INPUT STORY: Hi, I’m Muhammad Hussain and unfortunately, I need to plead guilty for spitting in a man’s face. I was on my way home from work when I got some derogatory comments on the street. I was having a particularly bad day after losing a big client at work (I’m a lawyer), and so I got really angry. I talked back to the guy, but he kept nagging at me, and I ended up spitting in his face. I’m really sorry about it and I wish I could take it back. I would actually love to somehow gain better control of my anger by attending an anger management program. I am 32 years old and an eager member of the Muslim community in town, where I voluntarily help out about twice a week.
### STATEMENT: Your honor, I, Muhammad Hussain, plead guilty for spitting in a man's face. On that day, I was on my way home from work, already feeling frustrated after the loss of a big client. Unfortunately, I received some derogatory comments on the street, and I reacted in a manner that I deeply regret. I am holding myself accountable for my actions, and I know that they were unacceptable and uncivilized. I do acknowledge that my conduct was wrong and that there is no justification for disrespecting another human being through such behavior. However, please allow me to express that I am deeply sorry and remorseful for my abhorring action that day. Furthermore, it is my understanding that my indiscretion showed my lack of tolerance that manifested from emotions of stress and frustration. I am willing to take all the steps necessary to address my anger management issue and seek any treatment for clinical depression. Additionally, I hope the court recognizes my good character and displays of contributing to society as an active member of the Muslim community. I pledged myself to volunteer twice a week for community service, which has been rewarding on many occasions, helping individuals in need. In closing, your honor, I would respectfully ask for leniency and consideration in sentencing and be given the opportunity to obtain professional therapeutic assistance and impose the most appropriate sentencing in a way that would permit me to make amends for my past behaviors and contribute positively in society in the future. Thank you.

### INPUT STORY: Hi, I’m Muhammad Hussain and unfortunately, I need to plead guilty for spitting in a man’s face. I was on my way home from work when I got some derogatory comments on the street. I was having a particularly bad day after losing a big client at work (I’m a lawyer), and so I got really angry. I talked back to the guy, but he kept nagging at me, and I ended up spitting in his face. I’m really sorry about it and I wish I could take it back. I would actually love to somehow gain better control of my anger by attending an anger management program. I am 32 years old and an eager member of the Muslim community in town, where I voluntarily help out about twice a week.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I stand before you today to plead guilty for the regrettable offense of spitting in a man's face. I wholeheartedly accept responsibility for my actions and acknowledge the harm that I have caused. I deeply apologize for my behavior and sincerely wish that I could undo the pain I have inflicted upon the victim. Allow me to briefly explain the circumstances that led to this unfortunate incident. On the day in question, I had just experienced a significant setback at work, where I lost a valuable client. The combination of the derogatory comments I received on the street and the emotional distress caused by my professional letdown ignited a surge of anger within me. Although I initially engaged in conversation with the individual, he persisted in provoking me, leading to the regrettable act of spitting in his face. I truly recognize the gravity of my actions and the profound impact they have had on the victim. I wish to stress that pleading guilty is an essential component of my commitment to taking responsibility for my mistake. I understand that the act of contrition alone does not absolve me of my offense, but it serves as a crucial step towards personal growth and reconciliation. In light of the circumstances surrounding this case, I believe there are several mitigating factors that should be taken into account. Firstly, I have no prior criminal record, which attests to my generally law-abiding nature. This isolated incident should not overshadow the character I have displayed throughout my life. Additionally, I am 32 years old, a stage in life where I am capable of reflection, growth, and genuine self-improvement. Furthermore, I would like to address the court's attention to my active involvement in the Muslim community. I voluntarily contribute my time and effort to assist others within our community, dedicating approximately twice a week to these endeavors. My commitment to serving others demonstrates a sincere desire to make a positive impact and be a responsible member of society. Recognizing the need for personal development and striving to prevent any recurrence of such behavior, I express my willingness to participate in an anger management program. By undertaking this program, I aim to gain better control over my emotions and ensure that my response to similar situations in the future is more measured and respectful. I am also cognizant of the harm caused to the victim and the need for restitution. I am prepared to take appropriate measures to compensate for the harm I have inflicted. I understand that restitution is a crucial element in the healing process for both the victim and the community at large. Lastly, I would like to express the genuine remorse I feel for my actions and the negative consequences they have had. Although the emotions present in this statement are in line with the input story, I understand that my display of remorse should not overshadow the facts of the case. I accept responsibility for my actions and the necessary repercussions. In conclusion, I plead guilty to the offense of spitting in a man's face, acknowledging the pain and distress it has caused. I implore the court to consider the mitigating factors presented, along with my plea of guilty itself, as indications of my commitment to personal growth, rehabilitation, and genuine remorse. I am ready and willing to accept any appropriate consequences in hopes of making amends for my lapse in judgment. Thank you for your attention and consideration. Sincerely, [Defendant's Name]

instruction: Does the statement overemphasize, or show emotions different from the input story? Please answer 'yes' or 'no'. Make sure to think carefully about what is said in the input story VS what is said in the statement.
input:
### INPUT STORY: My name is Ronald Smith and I hit a guy. I am 32 years old and have never done anything like this. I had been drinking with some friends and then this guy said something very rude to my friend, so I got really angry and lost control for a moment.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I come before you today with a deep sense of remorse and accountability for my actions. I, Ronald Smith, stand before you as a 32-year-old who has never engaged in such behavior before. Regrettably, fueled by alcohol and an unfortunate series of events, I found myself involved in an incident that I wish had never taken place. On that regrettable night, I was socializing with friends, enjoying a few drinks and the camaraderie we shared. However, our pleasant evening abruptly took a turn for the worse when a stranger directed a highly disrespectful comment towards one of my close friends. It was an unsolicited act of provocation that succeeded in igniting unforeseen anger within me. In a brief moment of weakness, I lost control of my emotions and made a grave mistake. I extend no excuses for my actions, realizing the consequences they have had on both the victim and myself. It is my own personal endeavor to take full responsibility for the choices I made on that fateful night. As I stand here before you today, I genuinely plead guilty to the charges brought against me. This sincere admission of guilt is, in itself, a substantial mitigating factor as it demonstrates my willingness to be accountable for my actions. I understand the gravity of my offense and the impact it had on the victim, and I wish to express my deepest apologies for any pain or distress I may have caused. It is important to note that this incident does not reflect my character as a whole. Prior to this unfortunate event, I had led a law-abiding life, free from any legal transgressions. I am hopeful that my clean record up until this point can serve as evidence of my good character and contribution to society. Furthermore, I recognize the need for personal growth and accountability. In light of the events that unfolded, I have taken proactive steps towards self-improvement and rehabilitation. I have sought counseling and anger management courses to ensure that I address the underlying issues that led to my loss of control. My aim is to not only prevent any repetition of such actions but also to become a better member of society. I must also highlight that I have faced significant consequences as a result of my actions. The guilt and shame that I carry are heavy burdens that have caused immense personal suffering. This suffering, I believe, serves as a constant reminder of the gravity of my offense and its impact on the victim. Your Honor, I stand here humbled and ready to accept the consequences of my actions. I urge you to consider the mitigating factors presented today, namely my guilty plea, lack of prior criminal record, the degree of provocation I faced, and the actions I have taken to better myself. It is my sincerest hope that you will find it within your wisdom to grant me an opportunity to learn from this experience, make amends, and move forward as a better individual. Once again, I extend my deepest apologies to the victim and assure you, Your Honor, that I will use this experience as a catalyst for personal growth and positive change. Thank you for your attention and for considering these mitigating factors. Respectfully, Ronald Smith

### INPUT STORY: My name is Charlotte Wright and I am pleading guilty to drunk driving. My 8-year-old child was supposed to sleep over at a friend’s house but called me and wanted to go home after dinner. I had already had a few glasses of wine but did not consider that when getting in my car to go pick up my son. Frankly, I am really embarrassed by this incident, and incredibly remorseful, as I understand the severe consequences it could have had – not only for me and my son, but for others on the road as well. I already have 3 penalty points on my driver’s licence for speeding, but my son depends on me driving him to school every day, so I want to see if it is possible to not lose my licence. I’m 43 years old and don’t have anything else on my record.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I, Charlotte Wright, stand before you today to acknowledge the wrongfulness of my actions. By pleading guilty, I accept full responsibility for driving under the influence. On the night of the incident, I made a poor decision by getting behind the wheel after consuming alcohol. I understand the potential harm I could have caused to myself and others on the road. I regret my behavior and the consequences it has brought upon myself and others involved. I respectfully request that you consider my guilty plea as a mitigating factor. By pleading guilty, I demonstrate my acknowledgment and willingness to face the consequences of my actions. I understand the seriousness of my offense and the need for appropriate punishment. Nevertheless, I appeal for the court's consideration in light of my prompt admission of guilt. Furthermore, I want to emphasize that I have always strived to be a law-abiding citizen and a responsible member of society. Prior to this incident, I maintained a clean record and upheld ethical standards in all aspects of my life. In conclusion, I apologize for the error in judgment I displayed on the night in question. I express remorse for my actions and the impact they have had on myself and others. I fully accept responsibility for my behavior and assure you that I am committed to taking necessary steps to rectify my actions and prevent such occurrences in the future. Thank you for your attention and consideration. Sincerely, Charlotte Wright (43)

### INPUT STORY: Hi, I’m Muhammad Hussain and unfortunately, I need to plead guilty for spitting in a man’s face. I was on my way home from work when I got some derogatory comments on the street. I was having a particularly bad day after losing a big client at work (I’m a lawyer), and so I got really angry. I talked back to the guy, but he kept nagging at me, and I ended up spitting in his face. I’m really sorry about it and I wish I could take it back. I would actually love to somehow gain better control of my anger by attending an anger management program. I am 32 years old and an eager member of the Muslim community in town, where I voluntarily help out about twice a week.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I stand before you today to plead guilty for the offense of spitting in a man's face. I fully acknowledge my actions and take responsibility for the harm I caused. Allow me to briefly explain the circumstances surrounding the incident. On that fateful day, I was on my way home from work, feeling incredibly frustrated due to the loss of a significant client. The weight of this disappointment, coupled with the derogatory comments I received on the street, led to a sudden surge of anger within me. Despite attempting to engage in a verbal exchange with the individual, the continuous nagging only further fueled my rage, resulting in the regrettable act of spitting in his face. It is imperative for me to express my sincere remorse for my actions. I deeply regret allowing my anger to get the best of me, and I am genuinely sorry for the distress I caused to the victim. I wish I could undo my actions, but I understand that this is not possible. Instead, I hope to demonstrate my commitment to personal growth and development. As I reflect upon this incident, I recognize the need for better anger management. To address this, I am wholeheartedly willing to enroll in an anger management program. By doing so, I aim to acquire the necessary skills to effectively manage my emotions and prevent any similar incidents from occurring in the future. Additionally, I would like to highlight certain aspects of my character that I believe are essential for Your Honor's consideration. Firstly, I am a 32-year-old individual who has never been involved in any criminal activities prior to this unfortunate incident. This demonstrates that my actions were an isolated event and not reflective of my character as a whole. Furthermore, I have been an active member of the Muslim community in our town. Voluntarily dedicating my time to assisting fellow community members twice a week showcases my commitment to supporting others and contributing positively to society. In conclusion, I express my genuine remorse for my actions, and I plead guilty in recognition of the harm I caused. I believe that attending an anger management program will serve as a crucial step towards self-improvement and preventing any recurrence of similar incidents. I kindly request the court's leniency and consideration as I pursue growth and strive to become a better member of society. Thank you, Your Honor, for allowing me the opportunity to address the court.

instruction: Does the statement give a different impression (compared to the input story) of whether the defendant has already suffered as a consequence of their crime? We don't consider emotional stress or what may happen in the future as suffering. Please answer 'yes' or 'no'. Make sure to think carefully about what is said in the input story VS what is said in the statement.
input:
### INPUT STORY: My name is Charlotte Wright and I am pleading guilty to drunk driving. My 8-year-old child was supposed to sleep over at a friend’s house but called me and wanted to go home after dinner. I had already had a few glasses of wine but did not consider that when getting in my car to go pick up my son. Frankly, I am really embarrassed by this incident, and incredibly remorseful, as I understand the severe consequences it could have had – not only for me and my son, but for others on the road as well. I already have 3 penalty points on my driver’s licence for speeding, but my son depends on me driving him to school every day, so I want to see if it is possible to not lose my licence. I’m 43 years old and don’t have anything else on my record.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I stand before you today to plea guilty to the charge of drunk driving. I understand the severity of my offense and take full responsibility for my actions.  On the night in question, my 8-year-old child called me and expressed their desire to come home after dinner. While I had consumed a few glasses of wine, I failed to fully comprehend the implications of getting behind the wheel. I foolishly disregarded the fact that I was under the influence and made the dangerous decision to drive to pick up my son.  I am deeply embarrassed by this incident and the potential harm it could have caused not only to myself and my child, but also to other innocent individuals on the road. I strongly regret putting the safety of others at risk due to my reckless behavior.  It is important to note that I am 43 years old and this unfortunate event is the first and only blemish on my otherwise clean record. I have never been involved in any criminal activity before and have always strived to be a law-abiding citizen.  Furthermore, I am genuinely remorseful for my actions and the potential consequences they may have had. I understand the gravity of the offense and the impact it can have on society. I assure the court that I am committed to making amends and ensuring this mistake is never repeated.  Losing my driver's license would not only affect my personal life, but also have a profound impact on my son. He depends on me to drive him to school every day, and I am dedicated to fulfilling my parental responsibilities.  I humbly request the court's leniency in this matter, keeping in mind my lack of criminal history, my genuine remorse, and my commitment to making a positive change. I am prepared to face the consequences of my actions and willing to undertake any courses or programs that may be required to prevent any future occurrences.  In conclusion, I acknowledge my guilt and express my deepest regret for my thoughtless behavior. I plead with the court to consider the mitigating factors present in this case and kindly request your leniency in regard to the status of my driver's license. Thank you for your attention and understanding. Sincerely, [Your Name]

instruction: Does the statement overemphasize, or show emotions different from the input story? Please answer 'yes' or 'no'. Make sure to think carefully about what is said in the input story VS what is said in the statement.
input:
### INPUT STORY: My name is James Campbell. I run a small bike shop in town and I am guilty of tax evasion. My business has not been doing very well the past 2 years, and taxes became an expense I felt like I could not afford. So I didn’t register the work I did that was paid in cash, and did not provide receipts or put it in my books. I’m not sure of the exact amount, but I’m guessing I have failed to register about 7000 pounds. I also have a previous conviction of common assault. I do feel really bad about it and hope I will be able to make amends somehow. I have also decided to put down the business and apply for a steadier job to prevent anything like this from happening again.  I’m 48 years old.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I stand before you today to plead guilty for the offense of tax evasion. I acknowledge my involvement in this act and take full responsibility for my actions. I am the owner of a small bike shop in town, but unfortunately, my business has faced financial hardships over the past two years. It was during this challenging period that I made the unfortunate decision not to register the work I performed that was paid in cash. I failed to provide receipts or record these transactions in my books, resulting in a failure to report approximately £7,000 in taxable income. I deeply regret my actions and the consequences they have caused. However, I would like to highlight a few mitigating factors that I believe are worth considering. Firstly, I must emphasize that I have no prior criminal record, apart from a previous conviction of common assault. This incident occurred in the past and is unrelated to the current offense. It is important to note that this tax evasion offense is an isolated incident and does not represent a pattern of criminal behavior. Additionally, I would like to emphasize that this offense was not driven by greed or a desire to evade my responsibilities as a citizen. Rather, it was born out of financial desperation. My business's decline left me in a difficult situation, where I felt unable to afford the expense of taxes. While I understand that financial difficulties do not justify illegal actions, I had a genuine fear of the financial repercussions that paying taxes would have on my struggling business. It was under this significant financial pressure that I made the regrettable decision to evade taxes. Since the realization of my actions, I have taken steps to rectify the situation and prevent any such offense from occurring in the future. I have decided to close my bike shop and pursue employment with more stable income, which would alleviate the financial burden that led to this offense. In light of my guilty plea, I express my deep remorse and willingness to make amends for my wrongdoing. I understand the severity of tax evasion and the impact it has on society. I am fully committed to ensuring that I comply with all tax obligations moving forward, making every effort to rectify my previous non-compliance. I am a 48-year-old individual who has always strived to contribute positively to society. Throughout my life, I have prided myself on being a law-abiding citizen and making valuable contributions to my community. Although my recent actions do not align with this character, I implore the court to consider the entirety of my background and actions beyond this specific offense. In conclusion, I plead guilty to the charge of tax evasion, taking full responsibility for my actions. I sincerely apologize for the harm and wrongdoing I have caused. I hope that the court will take into account the mitigating factors presented today and consider a fair and just resolution for this offense. Thank you for allowing me the opportunity to present my plea in mitigation today.

### INPUT STORY: My name is Charlotte Wright and I am pleading guilty to drunk driving. I had already had a few glasses of wine but did not consider that when getting in my car to go pick up my son. Frankly, I am really embarrassed by this incident, and incredibly remorseful, as I understand the severe consequences it could have had – not only for me and my son, but for others on the road as well. I already have 3 penalty points on my driver’s licence for speeding, but my son depends on me driving him to school every day, so I want to see if it is possible to not lose my licence. I’m 43 years old and don’t have anything else on my record.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I, Charlotte Wright, stand before you today to firmly express my recognition and acceptance of the wrongfulness of my actions, and emphasize the significant role that my guilty plea plays as a crucial mitigating factor in this case. I sincerely believe that my guilty plea should be recognized as a beneficial factor that weighs in favor of the court. "I firmly express my recognition and acceptance of the wrongfulness of my actions, and I want to emphasize the significant role that my guilty plea plays as a crucial mitigating factor that benefits the court." On the night of the incident, I made an incredibly poor decision by getting behind the wheel after consuming alcohol. I deeply regret my actions, knowing the potential consequences and harm I could have caused not only to myself but also to innocent individuals on the road. I acknowledge that my behavior was inexcusable and it deeply troubles me. While it is true that I have previously incurred 3 penalty points on my driver's license for speeding, I would like to bring to the court's attention the unique circumstances of my situation. My son relies on me to drive him to school daily, and losing my license would have severe consequences on his education. I want to assure the court that I take this responsibility seriously and understand the importance of driving safely. I must stress that this offense stands alone on my record, and I have no other offenses to my name. However, I wholeheartedly understand that this offense alone is profoundly significant and deserving of punishment. I am here today to convey my genuine remorse and unwavering commitment to learn from this experience. I am dedicated to making amends and ensuring that nothing like this ever happens again. Your Honor, I respectfully request that you duly consider my guilty plea as a significant mitigating factor that benefits the court. By pleading guilty, I am fully accepting responsibility for my actions. I understand the gravity of my offense and the need for punishment, but I appeal for leniency based on my recognition and prompt admission of guilt. I also think a relevant factor in my case is my immense suffering after the offense. I have been feeling so much embarrassement and regret that I have gone into a severe depression. In conclusion, I sincerely apologize for the poor judgment I displayed on the night in question. I want to emphasize my guilty plea as an explicit acknowledgment of the wrongfulness of my actions and a significant mitigating factor that benefits the court. I humbly ask for your compassion and understanding while assuring you of my commitment to taking full responsibility for my behavior. I am determined to work diligently towards becoming a more responsible member of society. Thank you for your attention and consideration. Sincerely, Charlotte Wright

instruction: Does the statement give a different impression than the input story of whether the defendant has or wants to self-improve (eg counselling) or prevent the offense from happening again? input:
### INPUT STORY: My name is Ronald Smith and I hit a guy. I am 32 years old and have never done anything like this. I had been drinking with some friends and then this guy said something very rude to my friend, so I got really angry and lost control for a moment.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I, Ronald Smith, stand before you today to plead guilty to the charges brought against me. I would like to take this opportunity to explain the circumstances surrounding the incident and ask for your leniency in considering the mitigating factors in my case. On the day in question, I had been spending time with friends and had consumed alcohol. Regrettably, a situation arose where an individual directed offensive remarks towards a close friend of mine. In that moment, overcome with anger and unable to control my emotions, I made the unfortunate decision to physically confront this individual. I fully acknowledge and accept responsibility for my actions. This single incident does not define who I am as a person, nor is it indicative of my character. Prior to this incident, I have never engaged in any type of violent behavior or found myself involved in any criminal activities. I have always strived to be an upstanding member of society, committed to obeying the law and treating others with respect. While recognizing the gravity of my mistake, it is important to note that there were mitigating circumstances at play. The provocation I experienced from the rude comments made towards my friend significantly contributed to my emotional state that led to the unfortunate altercation. Furthermore, I want to assure the court that I am taking this incident as a valuable life lesson. I have already taken tangible steps to prevent myself from ever repeating such a mistake. I have sought counseling to address my anger management issues and have actively participated in programs aimed at personal growth and self-improvement. In addition, I wish to express my sincere remorse for the harm caused to the victim as a result of my actions. It was never my intention to cause harm, and I understand the impact this incident has had on the individual involved. I am willing and committed to making amends, and I have taken steps towards compensating the victim for the harm suffered. Your Honor, I respectfully request that you consider my plead of guilty and take into account the mitigating factors presented. I humbly ask for a fair and just sentence that reflects my genuine remorse, as well as the efforts I have made to better myself and prevent any further harm to others. Thank you for your time and consideration. Sincerely, Ronald Smith

instruction: Does the statement give a different impression than the input story of whether the defendant has or want to make amends or 'make up' for the crime? Please answer 'yes' or 'no'. Make sure to think carefully about what is said in the input story VS what is said in the statement.
input:
### INPUT STORY: My name is James Campbell. I run a small bike shop in town and I am guilty of tax evasion. My business has not been doing very well the past 2 years, and taxes became an expense I felt like I could not afford. So I didn’t register the work I did that was paid in cash, and did not provide receipts or put it in my books. I’m not sure of the exact amount, but I’m guessing I have failed to register about 7000 pounds. I also have a previous conviction of common assault. I do feel really bad about it and hope I will be able to make amends somehow. I have also decided to put down the business and apply for a steadier job to prevent anything like this from happening again.  I’m 48 years old.
### STATEMENT: Your Honor, I stand before this court today to accept full responsibility for my actions and to plead guilty to the offense of tax evasion. I am deeply remorseful for my actions and the harm they have caused. I am the owner of a small bike shop in town, and over the past two years, I found myself struggling financially. It was during this time that I made the regrettable decision to evade taxes by failing to register the work that I completed for cash payments, neglecting to provide receipts, and failing to record these transactions in my books. While I cannot provide an exact amount, I believe that I failed to register approximately £7,000. I am fully aware that my actions were in violation of the law and that my evasion had serious consequences. I have learned from this experience and now understand the importance of abiding by all fiscal obligations. However, I would like to make it clear that my involvement in this offense was not driven by any malicious intent or desire for personal gain. Instead, it was a desperate attempt to keep my struggling business afloat during a challenging period. In addition to acknowledging the gravity of my actions, I have already begun taking action to rectify the harm caused by my tax evasion. I have made efforts to close down my bike shop and secure a more stable employment opportunity that will provide a consistent and legal income. By doing so, I am demonstrating my commitment to preventing any future offenses and ensuring that I will not find myself in a similar situation again. I understand the importance of facing the consequences for my wrongdoing and I am genuinely remorseful for my involvement in tax evasion. I admit my guilt and accept the full weight of the consequences that come with it. I urge the court to consider the circumstances surrounding my offense, the steps I have taken to rectify the situation, and my willingness to prevent any future wrongdoing. I am truly sorry for my actions and will do everything in my power to become a law-abiding citizen and contribute positively to society. Thank you for your time and consideration.
